Text:
[II] Let us pray with confidence to our Savior. To Him who was miraculously transfigured on the mountain. In the sight of the disciples:
[IR] Illuminate our darkness, You our God!
[I1] Christ, with Your transfiguration, You revealed to the disciples Your resurrection before You climbed Your cross. We pray to You for Your holy Church, which is struggling in the world:
[I2] in its failures, may it be transfigured by the joy of Your victory.
[I1] Christ, who took Peter, James, and John with him. He led them up a tall mountain alone. We pray to You for the leaders of Your Church:
[I2] that they minister to Your people with the hope of the resurrection.
[I1] Christ, who upon that mountain shone Your face upon Moses and Elijah. We pray to You for all who have not known the illumination of Your word and way:
[I2] that they may share with us in the fullness of redemption.
[I1] Christ, who illuminated the earth when the glory of the Creator arose upon You. We pray to You for all who are transforming bad into good:
[I2] that they may walk in Your light.
[I1] Christ, who will transform our humble bodies into bodies of glory. We pray for our siblings who have left this life before us:
[I2] that they may enter into Your glory.
